pullRequest.body:
If $f$ is a weighted homogeneous polynomial of degree $n$ with a finite set of variables $\\{X_i \mid i \in \sigma\\}$, then $n\cdot f = \sum_{i \in \sigma} w_i X_i \frac{\partial f}{\partial X_i}$, where $w_i$ are the weights.

Also add a lemma `pderiv_map` for the compatibility of `pderiv` with ring homomorphisms.

---

- [x] depends on: #13978

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

| %      | File |

| +9.02% | `Mathlib.Algebra.MvPolynomial.PDeriv` |

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.MvPolynomial.PDeriv | 1020 | 1112 | +92 (+9.02%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.HurwitzZetaValues` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ZetaValues`|8|
|<details><summary>33 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.GelfandDuality` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Harmonic.ZetaAsymp` `Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.PoissonSummation` `Mathlib.Analysis.Distribution.FourierSchwartz` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.EulerProduct.DirichletLSeries` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.DirichletContinuation` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.ZMod` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.Module.Constructions` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Isometric` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.JacobiTheta.Manifold` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.HurwitzZetaEven` `Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.AddCircle` `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Gaussian.PoissonSummation` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.SpecialFunctions.PosPart` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.JacobiTheta.OneVariable` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.Module.Defs` `Mathlib.Analysis.Fourier.FourierTransformDeriv` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.RiemannZeta` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Unique` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.JacobiTheta.Bounds` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.Dirichlet` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ApproximateUnit` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.JacobiTheta.TwoVariable` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.Nonvanishing` `Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.StarOrder` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Instances` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.Hom` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.HurwitzZetaOdd` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Order` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.PrimesInAP` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.HurwitzZeta` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.HermitianFunctionalCalculus` `Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Basic`</details>|9|
|<details><summary>10 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Sites.Etale` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.Group` `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.PosPart` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.DivisionPolynomial.Basic` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Smooth` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.Projective` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.Kaehler` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.Jacobian` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.DivisionPolynomial.Degree` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Etale`</details>|10|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Bernstein` `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.Weierstrass` `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.StoneWeierstrass`</details>|11|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.RingHom.StandardSmooth`|12|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.Polynomial` `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Presentation.Differentials` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.CotangentComplex` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.StandardSmooth`</details>|16|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.Bernstein`|61|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.MvPolynomial.PDeriv`|92|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsHomogeneous.pderiv`
`+ IsHomogeneous.sum_X_mul_pderiv`
`+ IsWeightedHomogeneous.pderiv`
`+ IsWeightedHomogeneous.sum_weight_X_mul_pderiv`
`+ X_mul_pderiv_monomial`
`+ _root_.Finsupp.sub_add_single_one_cancel`
`+ pderiv_map`
`+ pow`
`+ totalDegree_eq_zero_iff`
`+ weightedDegree_sub_single_add`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
My current plan to fix the timeout is to split MvPolynomial out of the Kaehler file ... will do tomorrow.

Presumably (since you asked me to review this), we want to prove `Jacobian.polynomial_relation` as an analogue of `Affine.polynomial_relation`? On the other hand that can be proven directly by `linear_combination`...

I don't think there's Affine.polynomial_relation, do you mean Projective? It's a bit painful to prove homogeneity, but I think it's a result we should have:
```
lemma polynomial_isWeightedHomogeneous : W'.polynomial.IsWeightedHomogeneous ![2, 3, 1] 6 := by
  rw [‚Üê mem_weightedHomogeneousSubmodule]
  refine sub_mem (add_mem (add_mem ?_ ?_) ?_) (add_mem (add_mem (add_mem ?_ ?_) ?_) ?_)
  ¬∑ exact (isWeightedHomogeneous_X _ _ _).pow _
  ¬∑ exact (((isWeightedHomogeneous_C ..).mul <| isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).mul <|
      isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).mul (isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..)
  ¬∑ exact ((isWeightedHomogeneous_C ..).mul <| isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).mul <|
      (isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).pow _
  ¬∑ exact (isWeightedHomogeneous_X _ _ _).pow _
  ¬∑ exact ((isWeightedHomogeneous_C ..).mul <| (isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).pow _).mul <|
      (isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).pow _
  ¬∑ exact ((isWeightedHomogeneous_C ..).mul <| isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).mul <|
      (isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).pow _
  ¬∑ exact (isWeightedHomogeneous_C ..).mul <| (isWeightedHomogeneous_X ..).pow _
```
Once it's proven, `polynomial_relation` should be easy.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#13978~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Please create a new file for this result, to avoid the import increase.

pullRequest.title: feat(MvPolynomial/PDeriv): Euler's (weighted) homogeneous identity
